title: IDC Foundation Innovation Fellowship
description: The IDC Foundation Innovation Fellowship is a merit-based scholarship awarded to students who demonstrate exceptional academic performance and career potential to develop innovative, interdisciplinary solutions to pressing societal needs.

title: Tau Beta Pi Fellowship
description: The Tau Beta Pi Association is the oldest engineering honor society in the US. The Fellowship Program is Tau Beta Pi's single most important project for the advancement of engineering education and the profession.

title: MENY Scholarship
description: The MENY was established as a society in April 1903 to promote and advance various engineering sciences in the City of New York and to elevate the standards of proficiency in technical services in the city. It became one of the leading technical and professional organizations in the city, further broadening the interpretation of professional affiliation, mission, goals, and objectives.
company: Municipal Engineers of the City of New York (MENY)

title: Innovators Scholarship
description: The Cooper Union's merit-based scholarship awarded to distinguished Cooper Union students.

title: Military Recognition of Exemplary Character
description: Awarded a certificate of recognition for exemplary character and leadership in the military by the mayor of Seoul, .

title: Full-tuition Scholarship
description: The Cooper Union's merit-based scholarship awarded to all Cooper Union undergraduate senior students in good standing.

title: Half-tuition Scholarship
description: The Cooper Union's merit-based scholarship awarded to all Cooper Union undergraduate students in good standing.

title: Dean Baker's Athletic Scholarship
description: The Cooper Union's merit-based scholarship awarded to distinguished Cooper Union student athlete.

title: Robert Greenwald Memorial Scholarship & Emanuel Salma Memorial Fund
description: The Cooper Union's merit-based scholarship awarded to distinguished Cooper Union students. This award was made possible through the generation donation of Dr. A. Seth Greenwald and Helen R, Loverro to The Cooper Union.
